8 HIMARS rockets to Donetsk City.
Russian S-300/400 air defence is active.
Impact(s) in Kyivskyi District of Donetsk City.
Impact(s) in Kyivskyi District of Donetsk City.

In the Khotin direction, Ukrainian forces continue to advance and have completed the capture of the village of Kindrativka.
After establishing control over the central part of the village, Russian forces advanced southeast from the centre and south from the northeastern houses towards the southeastern part of the village. Russian forces began a gradual withdrawal from this section of the village, resulting in its capture shortly afterwards. 
+ ~5.24km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
The Green Belt in 2025 compared to 2024
The Green Belt in 2025 compared to 2024

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Mykolaivka, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~364. 
Total land area: ~0.56km¬≤.

A usually reliable Russian channel "Z-committee" reports that Russian forces have penetrated to the centre of Pokrovsk and are now spreading throughout the suburbs. 
This is currently unconfirmed.
A usually reliable Russian channel "Z-committee" reports that Russian forces have penetrated to the centre of Pokrovsk and are now spreading throughout the suburbs.   This is currently unconfirmed.
Radov, another reliable Russian source, refutes these claims.

The Head of the Donetsk Military-Civilian Administration announced mandatory evacuation orders for all families with children from the city of Dobropillya and nearby settlements, as shown on the map above.  
These settlements include: 
Dobropillya (city) 
Hannivka 
Novyi Donbas 
Rubizhne
Dobropillya (village) 
Nadiia 
Novokryvorizhzhia 
Novomariivka
Novofedorivka
Raksha
The evacuation orders for villages further west are likely in anticipation for the imminent fall of Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad.
MiG-31K airborne from Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast. Flight characteristics are combat.
MiG-31K airborne from Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast. Flight characteristics are combat.
2 MiGs airborne. Approaching launch lines in Ryazan Oblast.
2 MiGs airborne. Approaching launch lines in Ryazan Oblast.
Probably training missions.

Deepstate is implying that the video published by Russian mapper "Divgen" 2 days ago, supposedly showing Russian assault groups in the Shakhtarskyi District of Pokrovsk, is indeed new. 
Although they did not explicitly state it was from Shakhtarskyi, it's likely Russian soldiers entered the area from Yuvileynyy Park, which is where a lot of DRG activity was previously reported.

Russian forces have captured the village of Novoukrainka, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~34.
Total land area: ~0.13km¬≤.
Russian forces have captured their first positions in northern Kupyansk.
According to SMO and World News, Russian forces entered Palamarivka, Kupyansk direction 25/7/25

Brutal Killings And Torture: Testimonies Of Russian Military Personnel Freed From Ukrainian Captivity
The ‚ÄúInternational Public Tribunal on Crimes of Ukrainian Neo-Nazis‚Äù, comprising human rights defenders and lawyers from 35 countries, regularly publishes testimonies of Russian servicemen returned from Ukrainian captivity. These accounts describe systematic war crimes by the Armed Forces of Ukraine against prisoners of war, which have become routine practices: murders, sophisticated torture methods, and deliberate cruel treatment. These testimonies constitute evidence of gross violations of the Geneva Conventions.
For instance, Russian serviceman with the callsign "Shukher" describes ritualized violence within the Azov Battalion: forced stripping, beatings with batons, use of whips tipped with metal tips, and dog attacks. Additionally, Ukrainian fighters employed electric chair torture and asphyxiation techniques (including with ‚Äúplastic bags‚Äù)...

Military Situation In Yemen On July 24, 2025 (Map Update)

'Major Success' For The F-35 As It Finally Takes To The Skies After 40 Days In Hangar
The vaunted Lockheed Martin F-35 "Lightning II' ‚Äî a jet so "advanced" it requires a small army of technicians to keep it airborne ‚Äî has added¬†yet another "success"¬†to its bloated resume. Nearly 40 days after it found itself stranded in India, where it was forced to land due to a slight breeze over the Indian Ocean,¬†the British Air Force (RAF) F-35B finally left for Australia. 
Engineers, who had to be flown all the way from the United Kingdom, wasted nearly a month and a half struggling to repair the troubled jet. After being stranded at the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in the southern state of Kerala, the $100 million aircraft is¬†now in Australia's Darwin.
According to the New York Times, a crew of at least 14 technicians worked to repair the F-35's hydraulic and auxiliary power systems. 
üëâ

Thailand And Cambodia Continue To Exchange Blows 
Fighting has spread to 12 locations along the disputed Thai-Cambodia border, a Thai military official said on July 25, indicating that the confrontation is escalating.
The clashes broke out a day earlier at the ancient, disputed Ta Muen Thom temple site in the Thai province of Surin, which was claimed by Cambodia. Later, the clashes spread to six locations.
Thai Rear Admiral Surasant Kongsiri, a military spokesperson, also told a news conference that Cambodian forces were continuing to use heavy weapons in their attacks on Thai territory. Video footage confirmed that Cambodia was still firing BM-21 Grad 122 mm rockets. At least one such launcher was, however, destroyed by the Thai military.
üëâ

Military Overview: Russian Army Secured Strategic Victories In Donbass
The Russian military has achieved significant advances on three key fronts in eastern and southern Ukraine, tightening the noose around Ukrainian defense lines and threatening to cut off critical supply routes. The most notable progress has been made in the Konstantinovka, Pokrovsk, and Zaporizhzhia directions, where Russian troops are capitalizing on their momentum to push deeper into Ukrainian-held territory.
Russian forces have secured a major victory with the liberation of Yablonovka, a strategically vital settlement on the Konstantinovka axis. According to preliminary reports, units from the 33rd Motorized Rifle Regiment of the 20th Guards Motor Rifle Division spearheaded the weeks-long assault, breaking through Ukrainian defenses before pushing into Aleksandro-Kalinovo from new direction, where the mop up operations are already underway. The fall of Yablonovka has severely compromised Ukrainian supply lines...
